recipes: The city is rife with journalists and detectives and other meddlers. How long will they leave me in peace?
The Bureau is charged with suppressing the less usual type of criminal - one whose crimes may exist only in dreams. My adversary seeks the evidence that might convince them to act.
The wrong kind of reputation might awaken the interest of the curious, the puritanical, or the vengeful. [A Reputation may inspire an adversary to emerge.]
My name, just now, is clear. Any watchers remain in the shadows.
My Adversary is Considering their Next Move
The Suppression Bureau won't act, yet. Does my adversary have any evidence at all?
My Adversary is Working to Build their Case
Can my enemy unearth more clues about my activities?
My enemy is frustrated. My name is clear, for now.
My adversary has no evidence of my activities, yet. But they're asking searching questions.
My enemy is frustrated. My name is clear, for now.
My Adversary Has Found Damning Evidence
This hunter is putting the finishing touches to their investigation
If this ever reaches trial, I will be in serious danger. Even if this hunter is disposed of, another may find their notes.
Rumour squats on rooftops and flutters in gutters. This hunter is making progress in their investigation.
There's always someone who doesn't understand, or who understands too well. This troublemaker may seek evidence on my activities to share with the authorities.
The Suppression Bureau has begun an investigation in earnest. They are charged with suppressing the less usual type of criminal - the criminal whose crimes may exist only in dreams.
inv end - won't display, loops straight to trial
I'll have to grease the right palm... or find a scapegoat.
My trial has begun, in a closed court. There are crimes whose existence the state does not admit. This is my last chance to find a diversion.
Money well-spent. One might consider it a kind of levy on genius
A believer is ready to make a sacrifice for the cause.
I regret the loss. But better them than me.
